abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Financial Sector Policy
            Based Guarantee Project for Montenegro were as follows:
            outcome was moderately unsatisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was significant, Bank performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory, and Borrower performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory. Some of the lessons learned include: (i)
            Policy-Based Guarantees (PBGs) can potentially be a useful
            instrument for supporting countries facing large external
            financing needs; (ii) PBGs implemented in a context of
            challenging macro-fiscal situation and large financing needs
            need to incorporate a consistent macro-economic framework
            with necessary macro and fiscal actions for risk mitigation;
            (iii) the choice of a PBG as an instrument should be based
            on robust macro and fiscal projections indicating that
            financing framework is sustainable and macro risks are
            mitigated; and (iv) comparing the aggregate interest rate of
            PBG-supported debt instruments with counterfactual market
            rates may not be enough for assessing the extent of
            reduction in the borrowing costs associated with the transaction.
